thread.title: Rangers notes: Antti Raanta part of select group - Hockey
thread.title_full: Rangers notes: Antti Raanta part of select group - Hockey - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Rangers notes: Antti Raanta part of select group - Hockey
text:
Select group 
Backup Antti Raanta became just the fourth goalie in Rangers’ history to earn a shutout in his first start with the team, per the Elias Sports Bureau, joining Hal Winkler (Nov. 16, 1926 in the Rangers’ first-ever game), John Ross Roach (Nov. 15, 1928) and Marcel Paille (Nov. 2, 1957).
His 22-save performance also extended his home record to 15-0-3 with a 1.51 goals-against average, a .944 save percentage and four shutouts in 20 home appearances. The first 19 came with the Blackhawks the previous two seasons.
"It’s a funny thing," Raanta said. "I remember the last couple of years in Chicago, we were always great playing the home games. I don’t know if I feel any different but, of course, the stats are there. I don’t want to talk too much about it and jinx it."
Raanta also became just the second Finnish goalie to play for the Rangers after Jussi Markkanen in 2003-04.
According to plan 
Coach Alain Vigneault said he did not consider inserting Henrik Lundqvist to try and stem a three-game losing streak.
"It’s been good for me to see a lot of action early on," said Lundqvist, the Rangers’ best player with a 3-2-1 record and 2.16 GAA. "I wanted to get into a nice flow and I appreciate that. At the same time, Antti needs to play. We need to get two guys going."
Briefs 
Left wing Viktor Stalberg notched his first goal as a Ranger to make it 4-0 at 16:44 of the third period. … The game marked the first time in team history the Rangers had Swedes (Stalberg, Jesper Fast, Oscar Lindberg), a Finnish player and a Norwegian (Mats Zuccarello) in their lineup. … Forwards Emerson Etem and Tanner Glass and defenseman Dylan McIlrath remained the healthy scratches.
— Andrew Gross
